meanings.sent1: She carefully undersows the seeds in the soil.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often undersow crops to ensure a successful harvest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel undersows acorns in the flower pots.
meanings.sent4: His kindness undersows hope in the hearts of those around him.
meanings.sent5: The gentle rain undersows life into the parched land.

meanings.definition: The act of sowing beneath or under.
meanings.sent1: The undersows of the seeds led to a bountiful garden.
meanings.sent2: The undersows of the roots helped the tree grow strong.
meanings.sent3: The secret undersows of the treasure chest were finally revealed.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet undersows of the night, the stars shine brightly.
meanings.sent5: The undersows of love can be felt in the smallest gestures.
